## Utils

Utils used to have a version of lodash added to it. However we have noticed that for tree shaking and updating wise we are now having lodash as a seperate module.

To see the full stack of commands you can use for lodash go _[here](https://lodash.com/docs/)_.

To import lodash functions simply use the following.


```javascript

import {COMMAND} from "lodash";

```

### Using Utils

Below are examples of how to use the Utils commands.

### `currentURL(): string`

```javascript

import {currentURL} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```

Returns the current URL

### `fuse(object: Object, [...sources: Object]): Object`

```javascript

import {fuse} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```

Like `_.merge` but simply replaces arrays instead of trying to merge them

### `getBodyDataAttribute(key: string): string`
```javascript

import {getBodyDataAttribute} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Returns a value if defined in the AEK template data

### `getEnv(): string`
```javascript

import {getEnv} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
In AEK environment this should return "prod" or "dev"

### `getEnvironment(): string`
```javascript

import {getEnvironment} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Same as above

### `getPackageData(): Object`
```javascript

import {getPackageData} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Returns package data for the working package (name, version, etc)

### `getPackageName(): string`
```javascript

import {getPackageName} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Returns the name of the current package

### `getPlatform(): string`
```javascript

import {getPlatform} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Should return "web", "ios" or "android"

### `getWindowDimensions(): {width: number,height: number}`
```javascript

import {getWindowDimensions} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Get dimensions of window

### `isDev(): boolean`
```javascript

import {isDev} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Returns `true` if running in dev environment

### `isNative(): boolean`
```javascript

import {isNative} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Returns `true` if platform is "ios" or "android"

### `isReactComponent(object: any): boolean`
```javascript

import {isReactComponent} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Returns true if the object is a React component

### `isWeb(): boolean`
```javascript

import {isWeb} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Returns `true` if platform is web

### `normaliseError(error: any): Error`
```javascript

import {normaliseError} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Returns an error from any given object. If the object is already an error - it'll just return itself

### `outerHeight(el: DOMElement): number`
```javascript

import {outerHeight} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Get the outer height (including margin) of an element

### `outerWidth(el: DOMElement): number`
```javascript

import {outerWidth} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Get the outer width (including margin) of an element

### `param(obj: Object): string`
```javascript

import {param} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Parameter serializer adapteed from jQuery.param

### `parseQueryString(str: string): Object`
```javascript

import {parseQueryString} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Parse a query string and return an object representation

### `plate(template: string, obj: Object, opts: Object): string`
```javascript

import {plate} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Like `_.template` but offers some support for undefined variables

### `titleCase(str: string): string`
```javascript

import {titleCase} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Converts the given string to title case

### `validateEmail(email: string): boolean`
```javascript

import {validateEmail} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Test to see if the given string is a valid email

### `validateTel(tel: string): boolean`
```javascript

import {validateTel} from "@ombiel/aek-lib";

```
Test to see if the given string is a valid telephone number
